intro: Apassalus parvulus, commonly known as the dwarf apassalus, is a small flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with compact, rounded foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers during the spring season. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in mild climates.
